decision_conditions: The replacement trees must be planted on or near the existing tree by April 2025; the replacement for tree 600, 601, 607, 370, 380, 365, 830 can be of any species of your choice  and of a size not less than 10-12cm girth when planted.

Reason: To ensure the continued amenity provided by the tree(s) and the planting of an appropriate species and in order to preserve the character and appearance of this part of Grange and White Ledges conservation area. | The tree work specified above must be carried out within 2 years of the date of this decision.

Reason: To ensure the work is only carried out once in respect of this consent and allow Ealing Council the opportunity to reconsider its decision in the light of prevailing circumstances, and reconsult on the case in the event of the consent expiring before implementation.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
TPO CH01 - Tree 596:  Pedunculate oak.  Remove small fractured branch at 9m on east side.
Tree 830:  Ornamental apple.  Remove
Tree 603:  Red oak.  Reduce crown by up to 2m
Tree 849:  Crack willow.  Re-pollard back to former pollard points
Tree 307:  Holly.  Reduce stems to 5m in height
Tree 365:  Lime.  Remove
Tree 370:  Silver maple.  Remove
Tree 380:  Hawthorn.  Remove
Tree 595:  Blue Atlas cedar.  Reduce crown by approximately 2m
Tree 607:  Flowering cherry.  Remove
Tree 319:  Hornbeam.  Remove branches close to street lamp to give 1m clearance from bulb
Tree 322:  Hornbeam.  Remove small growth close to street lamp, retaining large stem in close proximity
Tree 384:  Pedunculate oak.  Remove
Tree 873:  London plane.  Raise low branches over pavement to achieve 2-3m clearance
Tree 878:  London plane.  Raise low branches over pavement to achieve 2-3m clearance
Removal of two dead trees (600 birch, and 601 cherry)
